speaker: Skyline
text: The sun rises over the city._   [_Scene 1 - KACL Frasier is discussing the state of his show with Kenny._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Kenny, this is not amateur hour.  My show is already suffering enough just losing Roz.  I will not let you replace her with a complete novice.

speaker: Kenny
text: Come on, don't you remember when you were a young whippersnapper with nothing but a pantload of talent and a headful of dreams?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_pauses_] Are we still talking about Noel?  [_We see that Noel is in Roz's usual place with headphones on.  Roz is standing behind him._]

speaker: Noel
text: Five seconds to launch, Dr. Crane.  [_Kenny takes the opportunity to exit.  Frasier sits at the console._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Yeah. [_He puts on his headphones._] Good afternoon, Seattle, this is Dr. Frasier Crane.  Before we get to our first call, I'd like to remind you that we are losing our beloved producer, Roz Doyle in a couple of weeks to another career opportunity.

speaker: Roz
text: [_jumping in, to the microphone in front of Noel_] That's KPXY, the Mighty Pixy, Seattle's more exciting talk, Whoo-hoo!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_glares at Roz_] In the meantime, we have with us today Noel Shempsky, a KACL employee whose sole qualification for this job seems to be that he has never taken a sick day.

speaker: Noel
text: Good afternoon, listeners, near and stars away.  Our first query comes from a Class M planet we call Earth, and appears to be personal in nature. [_Frasier is putting his head in his palms and drumming his fingers._] Oh, and his name is Glen.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_drumming the console with his knuckles_] Go ahead, Glen, I'm listening.

speaker: Roz
text: [_to Noel_] Okay, Noel, that was good, but you need to tell Frasier the name of the caller, the town they're calling form, and why they're calling.

speaker: Noel
text: Okay.  [_rising_] You know, maybe I would learn more if you sat down behind me and guided my hands, like they did in _Ghost._  [_Roz has taken a seat in the chair.  Noel attempts to sit on her lap, misses, and falls down to the floor._]

speaker: Roz
text: Ooh!  Noel!! [_She recoils in disgust._]  [_Julia enters Roz's booth from the outside as Noel is in this compromising position.  He has now turned to face Roz and is on his knees._]

speaker: Noel
text: Oh, hi Julia!

speaker: Roz
text: Do you mind?  I'm trying to show Noel what I do.

speaker: Julia
text: [_wryly_] Is that why he's on his knees?  [_Julia walks through the door to Frasier and sits next to him._]

speaker: Roz
text: Get up.  Now let me give you some pointers on call screening. Your first priority are your leapers and jumpers.  Next up, angry people, they're great energy and a welcome change from our largest group, the sad sacks.  The trick of it is, you want to arrange these calls so that each segment is "can't miss" radio.

speaker: Noel
text: I thought it was just about Frasier doing good work.

speaker: Roz
text: Please, it's all about ratings!  If the station had its way, every call would end in an auto-erotic suicide.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you, Roz, now that Seattle knows how we do things around here, perhaps you could let Noel know to keep his elbow off the mic button.  [_Noel quickly moves his elbow, which he has been leaning on the console. Julia and Frasier snicker at Roz and Noel.  Fade out._]  [_Scene 2 - Frasier's apartment Frasier and Roz are seated at the dining table doing paperwork.  Martin is in his chair._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Roz, do you realize this is the last time we'll do paperwork together?

speaker: Roz
text: [_flatly_] Yeah, it's really sad.

speaker: Martin
text: What exactly is the new job, Roz?

speaker: Roz
text: Program director.

speaker: Martin
text: Ooh, now that's a job.  Let me give you a piece of advice.  Less smut and more older-people shows.

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah, I know, Martin, but that's not exactly what they're going for.

speaker: Martin
text: You could have a show about owning dogs, or how about this: A show where people just call in with jokes they've heard.  That'd be a riot.

speaker: Frasier
text: I think they're looking for a wider audience than just you, Dad.

speaker: Martin
text: Lots of people would be interested in that sort of thing.

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah, but the advertisers are looking for the young dollars.

speaker: Martin
text: What's wrong with my money?

speaker: Roz
text: You don't spend it all on fast food and beer.

speaker: Martin
text: Yes, I do!  [_rising_] You know, I'm tired of society blowing me off just because I'm a senior citizen.  You know, one day we're going to rise and take this country back from you young smart alecks.  And it won't be pretty either. [_He begins to exit._]

speaker: Roz
text: I could mention the joke idea to my boss.

speaker: Martin
text: You just bought yourself a little more time. [_He exits._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, here it is, Roz, the final parking requisition form.  The end of an era.  Listen, I know that Kenny is giving you a going- away dinner, but I wanted to have a little celebratory dinner, just the two of us, all right?  Any night you're free.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, Niles and Daphne are watching Alice.  How about tonight?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_rising_] Well, actually I'm-I'm meeting Julia later.

speaker: Roz
text: [_rising_] Why would you want to do that?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_walking behind the couch_] Well, we've sort of been seeing each other lately.

speaker: Roz
text: [_truly shocked_] You and Julia?!  She's a total bitch.

speaker: Frasier
text: Now, Roz, if you took the time to get to know her, you'd see that she's really not such a bad person.

speaker: Roz
text: Like get to know her naked, you mean.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_with irritation_] No.  I think she's been misjudged.  Sure, she's got a lot of walls up, but there must be something good inside if it needs that much protection.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, there are walls around prisons, too. [_She gets ready to leave._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, Roz, your opinion has been noted.

speaker: Roz
text: [_as she exits with her briefcase_] There are walls around insane asylums, cholera wards...

speaker: Frasier
text: [_holding the door_] Thank you, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: ...nuclear facilities, gator farms.

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, shut up.  [_She exits.  He closes the door.  Fade out._]  [_Scene 3 - Niles's and Daphne's apartment at the Montana Daphne is seated on a chair next to the fainting couch, wearing a pink boa and looking casual and relaxed.  Alice is chasing Niles.  She tags him._]

speaker: Alice
text: Got you!

speaker: Niles
text: [_playing_] Ooh!

speaker: Alice
text: Now you chase me!

speaker: Niles
text: [_winded_] Oh, no, I think it's Daphne's turn.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, no, I just had four turns in a row.  But you know who does want a turn?  The TV! [_She grabs Alice and seats her in front of the entertainment center._]  Come on, your video's all cued up. [_She sighs with relief and returns to her chair._]

speaker: Niles
text: Should we really be plopping her in front of the tube?

speaker: Daphne
text: It's an educational tape.  Did you want to read her more _Jung for Jungsters?_

speaker: Niles
text: She doesn't seem to respond to it.  Perhaps that's a treat we'll save for our own child.  When will that be?  When are we going to have a child of our own?

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, I don't know, when we're ready.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, we always say that, but how will we know when we're ready? I mean, if it were just me, I'm ready right now.

speaker: Daphne
text: I just don't feel like we're quite there yet.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, what has to change?  [_At this point, Gertrude Moon walks in the front door._]

speaker: Gertrude
text: What's this little brat doing here?  Make sure it don't make any noise. [_She exits upstairs._]

speaker: Daphne
text: Maybe it's me biorhythms.

speaker: Niles
text: [_laughing_] Daphne, might this have something to do with your mother living with us?  [_As he says this, he moves from the fainting couch to the coffee table to face Daphne.  He sits on one of Alice's toys, which squeaks.  He and Daphne laugh as he removes it._]

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, I've always thought in the back of my head that we'd start a family after she left.

speaker: Niles
text: But that doesn't have to stop us from getting pregnant.  And once we are, we've got nine months to get her out of the house.

speaker: Daphne
text: Are you kidding?  If she found out there's a grandchild on the way, she'd never leave.  And I don't think I could take Mum

speaker: Niles
text: [_lovingly_] Oh the other hand, a grandmother can be a wonderful influence on a child.  [_Gertrude re-enters from the stairway._]

speaker: Gertrude
text: Alice...you help Auntie Gert find her cigarettes, and you can have one.  [_She smiles and walks to the kitchen.  Daphne smiles knowingly at Niles, who chuckles.  Fade out._]  **AND LEAVE ALL THIS?**  [_Scene 4 - An elegant dining room.  It is Roz's going-away party. Kenny, Frasier, Noel, Bulldog, Gil, Julia, and others are present._]

speaker: Kenny
text: [_standing and tapping a glass with a spoon_] I think now would be a good time if anyone wants to stand up and say a few words to Roz.  I know I'll miss her, which is why I'm proud to present her with this picture of the two of us at the last company picnic. [_He hands her a 4X6 snapshot._] Won't that baby look nice in a frame?  Enjoy.  [_Kenny pats her on the shoulder and sits down.  Noel rises._]

speaker: Noel
text: I'm next.  [_Noel pulls out a page, which he unfolds and from which he then reads._]

speaker: Noel
text: "Sweetest Roz, you are my ship when I'm at sea, my fairest rose, my fantasy.  With each sunrise my thanks I send, for you, my love, my true best friend."  [_Roz seems genuinely touched by Noel's speech.  Bulldog makes faces while Noel is reading.  After he finishes, most attendees are polite and say "Nice," etc.  Bulldog reacts quite differently._]

speaker: Bulldog
text: Puke!

speaker: Noel
text: That was beautiful, you son of a b.

speaker: Bulldog
text: [_rising_] Okay, everyb...[_Noel is in his face._] Sit down.  Sit down, Noel, sit down!  Okay, everybody, Bulldog to the rescue. Now, I don't want to say Roz has had a lot of sex, but she's spent more time on her back than King Tut. [_Frasier, Julia, Kenny, and Roz all have stunned looks on their faces._]  Did you hear the story about the guy at KACL who _didn't_ have sex with Roz?  Me neither.  But, uh, seriously--what's the difference between Roz and a dog in heat? [_Frasier covers his face._] No, really, I'm asking. [_uncomfortable pause_] You people suck!

speaker: Frasier
text: It's not a roast, Bulldog.

speaker: Bulldog
text: It's not?  I paid a guy at the Chuckle Factory 50 bucks to write jokes for me.

speaker: Gil
text: When's he getting here?

speaker: Bulldog
text: Okay, okay, you want a speech?  Best of luck in your new job, Roz. [_She smiles and raises her glass to him._] If you ever need a sports guy, I'm your man.  And I wouldn't have any problem with you being my boss.  After all, I know what it feels like to be underneath you.  Am I right?

speaker: Noel
text: [_rising angrily to confront Bulldog_] Watch what you SAY ABOUT HER!!  [_Frasier restrains Noel.  Bulldog rushes away from him._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Noel!  Come on.  Walk it off, Noel, walk it off.

speaker: Gil
text: Careful, gents!  Really, the way you two are always carrying on, people are going to start talking. [_He grins cheesily and rises._] Hello, all.  Gil Chesterton here, with a toast to Roz Doyle.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hear, hear.

speaker: Gil
text: A wonderful co-worker, and a good friend.

speaker: All
text: Hear, hear.

speaker: Gil
text: Of course, I too noticed Roz's sex appeal immediately.  She had the same effect on all of us stallions in the KACL corral.  She made us want to paw the ground and rise up on our powerful haunches [_becoming more passionate_], fetlocks glistening.  Smokey, Misty, Storm!  Away!  [_Gil downs his entire glass.  His overwrought "heterosexuality" has made everybody uncomfortable._]

speaker: Kenny
text: Okay, bar's closed.  Gil?  [_Kenny whistles and motions for Gil to sit, which he does._]

speaker: Kenny
text: Uh, Julia, your turn.

speaker: Julia
text: [_taken a bit by surprise, but very sincerely_] Oh!  Uh, well, I've only known Roz a short time, but I can see that she's a valuable member of this team, and I'm sure you'll be missed. Good luck.  [_This is the most sincere and respectful speech yet.  Given the source, all are surprised.  All raise their glasses.  Frasier rises._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Well said, well said.  Roz...I celebrate your new adventure with you, but I wouldn't be honest if I didn't say that this is a big loss for me.  You were there on my first day at KACL, and you took me under your wing.

speaker: Bulldog
text: [_grinning_] It's crowded under there.

speaker: Noel
text: [_menacingly whispering to Bulldog_] I will kill you!  [_Bulldog moves a bit away.  Roz smiles uncomfortably._]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_continuing_] I don't think I'll ever grow accustomed to seeing somebody else in your booth.  And certainly noone else can ever take your place in our hearts.  And while we welcome new friends... [_He places his arm on Julia's shoulder and looks at her with affection.  Roz has a reaction of discerinble pain when she sees this._]...we are sad to say good-bye to old ones.  Good luck, Roz.

speaker: All
text: Hear, hear!  Speech!  Come on, Roz, speech!

speaker: Roz
text: [_rising and clearing throat_] Thanks you guys. [_She sees Julia comfortably resting her arm on Frasier's shoulder._] I just love you all for doing this for me.  We really are like a family, aren't we?  You know, this job at KPXY is a really great, great opportunity.  But it'll never be like this.  Which is why I'm changing my mind.  I can't leave KACL, I'm staying!

speaker: Kenny
text: Really!  [_He hugs her.  Others react similarly.  All applaud.  Frasier rises and gives Roz a hug and a kiss on the cheek.  Julia applauds with the rest, but the look on her face is uncomfortable and suspicious.  Fade out._]  _END OF ACT I   ACT II_  [_Scene 5 - Cafe Nervosa Frasier and Roz approach the counter, where Gertrude is working._]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_into his phone_] Thank you very much. [_hanging up his phone_] Oh.  Mrs. Moon, we'd like to get two double lattes to go, please.

speaker: Gertrude
text: [_smiling_] For an extra dollar, I can add a nip of brandy.

speaker: Frasier
text: Is that on the menu?

speaker: Gertrude
text: [_pulling a whiskey bottle from her blouse_] It's on the _secret_ menu.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'll pass, thank you.

speaker: Roz
text: You know, Frasier, I feel so invigorated to get back to my old job.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Roz...

speaker: Roz
text: In fact. I'd really like to record some promos tonight if you're available.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I can't.  I'm taking Julia to the movies.  One of my favorites, _Noch Einen Stuhl_.

speaker: Roz
text: _Noch Einen Stuhl?_

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, it's the story of a 19th-century Austrian family as told from the point of view of an old fireside armchair.

speaker: Roz
text: I'm sorry, I dozed off, what were you saying?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_after giving her a look_] You know what, I've got to get an alternative newspaper to check show times.  I'll be right back.

speaker: Gertrude
text: [_bringing their order_] Here we are.  [_Frasier's cell phone, which he has left on the counter, rings._]

speaker: Gertrude
text: Your phone's ringing.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, it's not mine, it's Frasier's.  [_The phone continues to ring.  Roz checks the caller ID and drops the phone._]

speaker: Roz
text: Ooh!  It's Julia.

speaker: Gertrude
text: Who's that?

speaker: Roz
text: This witch who's trying to get her hooks into Frasier. [_enunciating to the phone_] I hate her.

speaker: Gertrude
text: I'll fix her.  [_Gertrude answers the phone._]

speaker: Roz
text: Wh-what are you doing?

speaker: Gertrude
text: [_waving Roz off, talking to the phone in a "seductive" voice_] Hello.  [_pause_] Oh, I'm sorry, Frasier's in no position to talk, if you, uh, get my meaning.  Who's this, then?  Hold on. [_She holds the phone at a short distance._] Sweetheart?  Do you want to talk to a Julia? [_giggling girlishly_] Oh!  Frasier, put me down! [_normal voice_] Sorry, he's not here after all.  Bye, now. [_She hangs up quickly._]  There.  Problem solved.

speaker: Roz
text: You know, you probably ruined their entire evening.  How can I thank you?  [_Frasier returns, grabbing his phone._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Only one showing of _Noch Einen Stuhl_ tonight.  Got to go by the box office and pick up the tickets.

speaker: Roz
text: [_sarcastically_] Yes, I bet they're going fast.  [_They head to the exit, and run into Niles and Daphne, who are coming in._]

speaker: Daphne
text: Hello!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, sorry!  Wish we could join you guys.  I'm going to get tickets for _Noch Einen Stuhl!_

speaker: Niles
text: [_checking his watch_] Cutting it a little close, aren't you?  [_Frasier and Roz exit.  Niles and Daphne approach a table._]

speaker: Daphne
text: Hey, Mum!  Whan you finish your shift, we'll drive you home.

speaker: Gertrude
text: Really?  Are you sure it wouldn't give you more pleasure to see me walk home on my bloody stumps?

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, it would, but we're in a hurry.

speaker: Niles
text: We'll, uh, we'll be here when you're ready.  [_They observe a mother with an infant in a carrier._]

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, Niles...

speaker: Niles
text: Oh...

speaker: Daphne
text: Just think, one day we'll have one of those.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, just one awkward chore to get out of the way.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, that's romantic.

speaker: Niles
text: I meant asking your mother to move out.

speaker: Daphne
text: We're not asking her, Niles, we're telling her!

speaker: Niles
text: I know, I know.

speaker: Daphne
text: You have to be firm.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes.

speaker: Daphne
text: This is a woman who came for a week and stayed for a year and a half.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, I know, I just think that--

speaker: Daphne
text: It's not like she's got no place to go.  She's got seven other children!

speaker: Niles
text: I know.

speaker: Daphne
text: Plus a home and friends in England.

speaker: Niles
text: Many friends, yes, I just, I...I just don't know how to break it to her.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, the sooner we do, the sooner we can start our own family.

speaker: Niles
text: You're right.  Do you realize, this time next year we could be sitting here with our own baby?

speaker: Gertrude
text: [_overhearing as she walks by_] Baby?  What's this, then?

speaker: Daphne
text: We'll talk about it later.

speaker: Gertrude
text: I want to talk about it now.  What's going on?

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, I was going to wait until later, but if you really want to know, we--

speaker: Niles
text: Wait, wait, Daphne, Daphne. [_clears throat_] We've decided to start trying to get pregnant.

speaker: Gertrude
text: Oh, well, I'm glad you think you can.  I was beginning to think there might be something wrong with your equipment, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: [_this is the motivation he needs_] Oh, were you?  Well, here's more news: you're out of the house, so go pack your bags and find another sucker.  [_Gertrude reacts.  Julia has entered and stands behind her._]

speaker: Julia
text: Excuse me.  Can I get some service over here?

speaker: Gertrude
text: Keep your knickers on.  Don't move.  We're not done hashing this through.  [_She goes behind the counter and changes her attitude to take Julia's order._]

speaker: Gertrude
text: [_in the "singsong" voice she used to answer Frasier's phone_] Hello!

speaker: Julia
text: [_recognizing the voice, and suspiciously imitating it_] Hello!

speaker: Gertrude
text: [_again singsong_] Hello!

speaker: Julia
text: Say that again.

speaker: Gertrude
text: [_singsong_] Hello?

speaker: Julia
text: Now say, "Frasier's in no position to talk, if you get my meaning."

speaker: Gertrude
text: [_immediately giving in_] Now, it was all Roz's idea.  I had no choice.  I'm not a well woman.  [_She exits to the back.  Julia reacts.  Fade out._]  [_Scene 6 - KACL Julia enters the studio and confronts her._]

speaker: Julia
text: Hello, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: Julia.

speaker: Julia
text: [_closing the door_] I just talked to that waitress over at Nervosa. The one that answered Frasier's phone?  She gave you up immediately.

speaker: Roz
text: [_forcing laughter_] Relax?  It was just a joke.

speaker: Julia
text: Okay.  So what's going on?  Do you have some sort of problem with me seeing Frasier?

speaker: Roz
text: Well, as long as you're asking...I think you're all wrong for him.

speaker: Julia
text: That's not your call.

speaker: Roz
text: I think I know Frasier a little better than you.  [_Roz walks back to her booth.  Julia, clearly deeply offended and hurt, but remaining calm, follows her._]

speaker: Julia
text: So?

speaker: Roz
text: So...he deserves someone better.  Someone who'll appreciate him.

speaker: Julia
text: [_barely keeping her cool_] Oh, really?

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah.  Frasier's a good guy.  He's smart and sweet and way too good for you.  Why don't you just leave?  Nobody here likes you anyway.

speaker: Julia
text: [_stoically_] Frasier seems to.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, he's an idiot.

speaker: Julia
text: Are you trying to save Frasier from me or are you trying to save him for yourself?

speaker: Roz
text: Are you out of your mind?

speaker: Julia
text: [_genuinely_] Are you in love with him?

speaker: Roz
text: Go to hell, Julia!

speaker: Julia
text: That would explain why you turned down that great job.

speaker: Roz
text: [_faltering_] That is not true.  [_At this point, Noel, Gil, Kenny, and Bulldog have all gathered at the window and begun to observe the confrontation._]

speaker: Julia
text: Then stay out of my way.

speaker: Roz
text: Or what?

speaker: Julia
text: Do you want to find out?

speaker: Roz
text: What, are you going to hit me or something?

speaker: Julia
text: Don't think I won't.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, you're sure taking your time.  [_Others have joined the foursome at the window.  Julia and Roz both shoot them an angry glance, and they quickly turn away their faces._]

speaker: Roz
text: Stay away from him?  Got it?  [_Julia retains her calm but cool composure.  Roz exits the booth and chases away the voyeurs._]

speaker: Roz
text: Get out of here!  [_They quickly disperse.  Julia remains standing in the booth, contemplating what has just transpired.  Fade out._]  [_Scene 7 - Niles and Daphne's apartment Gertrude is standing in the doorway, nicely dressed and surrounded by her luggage._]

speaker: Gertrude
text: Well, I guess this is goodbye.  Um, I just want you to know, I love you both very much, and I'm, you know, looking forward to standing on my own two feet again.  [_Niles and Daphne nod without emotion._]

speaker: Gertrude
text: Uh, thank you for the ticket and the luggage and the clothes and the spending money. [_gasping_] I'm sorry.  This is just so sad.

speaker: Niles
text: [_caving_] Gertrude, are you sure you're okay...

speaker: Daphne
text: [_interrupting, bluntly and without emotion_] Good-bye, Mum, have a nice trip.  Say hello to everyone in Manchester for me.

speaker: Gertrude
text: Right, then. [_She kisses Daphne on the cheek._] Good-bye, Niles. [_She embraces him._] I know you'll be a wonderful father to my grandchild.  I hope you'll find time to send me a picture.

speaker: Niles
text: [_caving again_] Can't we all just talk--

speaker: Daphne
text: [_interrupting_] We have your address.

speaker: Gertrude
text: I'm off. [_She exits.  Her whole demeanor has changed in this exchange.  She has been less abrasive and more sincere._]

speaker: Niles
text: [_barely containing himself_] Bye.  [_Daphne closes the door._]

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, Daphne, you were wonderful.  I don't know how you did it.  [_Daphne suddenly breaks down in a fit of uncontrollable sobs._]

speaker: Daphne
text: Hold me, Niles.  [_They embrace.  She continues to weep._]

speaker: Niles
text: Hang on, hang on. [_yelling_] Gertrude!  [_He opens the door.  She is standing right there, sobbing uncontrollably._]

speaker: Gertrude
text: Yes?

speaker: Niles
text: Come here, come here.  [_She enters the apartment._]

speaker: Niles
text: Would you be willing to stay in Seattle if, say, you had your own apartment?

speaker: Daphne
text: [_breathlessly_] Oh, Niles!

speaker: Gertrude
text: Do you really mean that?  I mean, I don't want to intrude.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, of course I mean it.  And-and-and we'd even help with the rent.

speaker: Gertrude
text: [_beginning to return to her old self_] Define "help."

speaker: Niles
text: We'll talk.

speaker: Gertrude
text: Well, then, it's settled.  I'll just go tell the taxi I'm not going!

speaker: Niles
text: No, no, no.  You're going.  Just tell them to take you to the Four Seasons.  I'll go ahead and call and book you a room.

speaker: Gertrude
text: You've made me so happy, I think I'm going to cry!  [_She embraces Niles.  He laughs nervously.  Daphne smiles lovingly._]

speaker: Gertrude
text: Niles, I...I don't know how to thank you.  [_She exits.  Niles closes the door._]

speaker: Daphne
text: [_warmly_] I do.  [_She leads Niles away by the hand.  Fade out._]  [_Scene 8 - Frasier's apartment Martin answers the door to Roz._]

speaker: Roz
text: Hey, Martin.

speaker: Martin
text: Hi, Roz.  Come in.

speaker: Roz
text: Is Frasier here?  I really need to talk to him.

speaker: Martin
text: No, he went out for dinner.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, let me guess: Julia.

speaker: Martin
text: [_a bit shocked_] Wow!  Not a fan, huh?

speaker: Roz
text: I can't stand her actually.

speaker: Martin
text: Really? [_chuckling_] Well, I just met her this evening, but she seemed nice to me.  [_Martin moves to sit in his chair._]

speaker: Roz
text: [_sitting on the coffee table_] Well, that's because she's got you snowed.  She's a mean, snooty tight-ass who thinks she's better than everybody else, and Frasier's making a giant mistake and somebody's got to do something about it.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, good luck, when Frasier's heart takes over his brain shuts out.

speaker: Roz
text: That's why we have to do something now, before this _relationship_ gets any closer.  Will you help me?

speaker: Martin
text: [_tentatively_] Well, Roz, if you feel that strongly about it, sure, I'll back you up.  [_Frasier and Julia enter.  Julia is carrying a cake box._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, hi guys!

speaker: Martin
text: Hey!

speaker: Frasier
text: Hi, Roz!

speaker: Julia
text: Hello, Roz.  Nice to see you.

speaker: Roz
text: Julia.

speaker: Julia
text: [_enthusiastically_] Martin, I've brought you some cake from the restaurant.

speaker: Martin
text: Restaurant cake? [_He begins to get up._]

speaker: Roz
text: Steady...

speaker: Julia
text: [_from the kitchen entry_] It's chocolate.  Why don't I cut you a slice and pour you some milk?

speaker: Martin
text: [_standing, to Roz_] New plan.  I'll distract her while you talk to Frasier.  [_Martin follows Julia into the kitchen.  Frasier returns from the coat racks._]

speaker: Frasier
text: What's going on, Roz? I didn't expect to see you tonight.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, um, I have something really important to talk to you about, and I really need you to listen to me.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, absolutely, that's what I do.  [_Frasier sits on the arm of Martin's chair, Roz on the coffee table._]

speaker: Roz
text: I really, really, really think you should stop seeing Julia.

speaker: Frasier
text: Look, I know you two have your difficulties.

speaker: Roz
text: [_cutting him off_] No!  It's not that.  She's all wrong for you.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_after a pause_] I think I see what's going on here.  You and I have a close relationship.  A new woman comes to the radio station.  She and I form a close relationship, and you feel threatened.

speaker: Roz
text: No.  She's evil. [_Frasier is taken aback._] It's not your fault. You can't see it because she puts on an act around you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Did it ever occur to you that maybe she's putting on an act for everybody else, and that maybe _I_ see her as she really is?

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, she's got you totally brainwashed.

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, you have no right to come over here and run her down to me. It's really none of your business.

speaker: Roz
text: This _is_ my business!

speaker: Frasier
text: And why?

speaker: Roz
text: Because...we're friends. [_She suddenly becomes quite passionate._] I can't believe you're turning on me like this!  I gave up a job that was ten times better to stay on your show!

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, and frankly, I don't understand that!  Why exactly did you turn down that job?  [_They both rise._]

speaker: Roz
text: Out of loyalty to you!

speaker: Frasier
text: Loyalty to me?  Are you sure?  Are you sure it wasn't just fear? Are you sure you're not just using me as an excuse not to grow and move on?  [_Julia enters from the kitchen._]

speaker: Julia
text: [_cheerily_] Who wants restaurant cake?  [_Frasier turns to her uncomfotably._]

speaker: Roz
text: You're going to have to choose, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_angrily_] You will _not_ put me in this position, Roz.  We will discuss it later!

speaker: Roz
text: [_shouting_] No!  Tell me!  [_pointing_] It's _her_ or me!  Tell me now, or I swear to God I will walk out of here and I will not come back!  [_Frasier is clearly angered and offended that Roz has presented him with such a choice.  He glares at her and walks to Julia's side._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you, Julia, I think I will have some cake.  [_Again he glares at Roz._]

speaker: Roz
text: [_stunned, weakly_] Fine.  [_She picks up her purse and exits dramatically.  Julia faces Frasier and comforts him with what seems to be real affection.  Fade out._]  [_Scene 9 - KPXY studio The station manager, Woody Wizwell, is showing Roz her office._]

speaker: Wiswell
text: And this will be your office, Ms. Doyle.  Make yourself at home.

speaker: Roz
text: Thank you, Mr. Wiswell.

speaker: Wiswell
text: Uh, there's no chance you'll change your mind again, is there?  [_Roz is setting up at her desk._]

speaker: Roz
text: No.  KACL is ancient history.
